snippet: The government’s near-complete takeover of the cities of Homs and Idlib fueled frustration with an exile group.
abstract: Main Syrian exile opposition group, the Syrian National Council, suffers a serious fracture as several prominent members resign, calling the group autocratic, dominated by the Muslim Brotherhood and powerless to help Syrian rebels as government forces move into the rebellious southern city of Dara’a.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Hala Droubi from Beirut, Alan Cowell from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The government’s near-complete takeover of the cities of Homs and Idlib fueled frustration with an exile group.

headline.main: Syria Opposition Group Is Routed and Divided
headline.print_headline: Syria Opposition Group Is Routed and Divided
